case_vignette:
A 39-year-old woman seeks evaluation from her gynecologist due to recent changes in her menstrual cycle. Her last menstrual period was greater than 12 months ago. She has 2 children and had regular menstrual periods in the past. She also complains of difficulty in falling and staying asleep, occasional hot flashes, vaginal dryness, and decreased libido. The physical examination is unremarkable, and the height and weight are 1.68 m (5 ft 6 in) and 70 kg (154 lb), respectively. She has the following hormonal panel from 2 months ago when she first sought help for her symptoms.
Hormonal panel results  
Human Chorionic Gonadotropin 4 IU/L (0.8 - 7.3 IU/L)
Thyroid Stimulating Hormone 2.5 mIU/L (0.4 - 4.2 mIU/L)
Prolactin 5 ng/mL (2-29 ng/mL)
Follicle Stimulating Hormone 45 mIU/mL (Follicular phase: 3.1-7.9 mIU/mL; Ovulation peak: 2.3-18.5 mIU/mL; Luteal phase: 1.4-5.5 mIU/mL)
Estradiol 5 pg/mL (Mid-follicular phase: 27-123 pg/mL; Periovulatory: 96-436 pg/mL; Mid-luteal phase: 49-294 pg/mL)
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

I've noticed changes in my menstrual cycle, I haven't had a period for over 12 months, I'm having trouble sleeping, experience occasional hot flashes, vaginal dryness, and a decreased interest in sex.
Have you had any other symptoms such as weight gain, mood changes, or joint pain?
No, I haven't had symptoms like weight gain, mood changes, or joint pain.
Have you had any history of miscarriage or ectopic pregnancy?
I haven't mentioned any history of miscarriage or ectopic pregnancy.
Have you had any history of irregular menstrual cycles or polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)?
No, my menstrual cycles were regular in the past, and I haven't mentioned having polycystic ovary syndrome.
Have you had any history of thyroid or pituitary disorders?
I haven't mentioned any history of thyroid or pituitary disorders.
Have you had any history of autoimmune disorders such as lupus or rheumatoid arthritis?
I haven't mentioned any history of autoimmune disorders like lupus or rheumatoid arthritis.
Have you had any history of ovarian cysts or endometriosis?
I haven't mentioned any history of ovarian cysts or endometriosis.
Have you had any history of hormonal imbalances or menopause?
I haven't explicitly mentioned a history of hormonal imbalances, but the changes in my menstrual cycle and other symptoms suggest I may be going through menopause.
Final Diagnosis: Menopause.
